biography.summary: John F. Reed, commonly known as Jack Reed, is a United States Senator from Rhode Island, serving since 1997. He is a member of the Democratic Party and has been a leading voice on national security, veterans' affairs, and fiscal policy. Prior to serving in the Senate, he represented Rhode Island in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1991 to 1997.

contact.office_address: 728 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

timeline.event: Elected to the United States Senate from Rhode Island.
Re-elected to Senate; continued service as senior senator.
